intro: Heteropterys platyptera var. martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique star-apple, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the Caribbean. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are followed by edible, star-shaped fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in tropical horticulture and ecological studies.
